City Council
Regular Meeting
3/4/2024 5:30 PM
Sullivan Chamber
Cambridge City Hall   795 Massachusetts Ave   Cambridge, MA 02139
Downloads:
Agenda Summary Agenda Packet
Call to Order
Roll Call
Pledge of Allegiance
Submission of the Record
1. Minutes of Feb 13, 2024 8:30 AM
Public Comment
I. City Manager's Agenda
1. CMA 2024 #28 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Annual Surveillance Report concerning City Departments’ use of Surveillance Technology or Surveillance Data.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. 2024 ASR combined final(v2)
2. CMA 2024 #29 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a Surveillance Technology Impact Report which describes interim Operations & Case Management Software, requested by the Community Safety Department.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. Community Safety_STIR_Operations + Case Management Software_February 2024 (002)
3. CMA 2024 #30 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to POR 2024#12 12 That the City Manager is requested to work with the Traffic & Parking Department to take immediate action and make safety improvements to the intersection of Cardinal Medeiros Ave, Binney St, and Bristol St.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. POR 2024-12-Cardinal Medeiros rev3
4. CMA 2024 #31 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of 1,266,327 to the Grant Fund Fire Extraordinary Expenditures account. Funds will be used to purchase equipment to support the hazardous materials response team.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
5. CMA 2024 #32 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the final report from the Police Executive Research Forum (PERF).
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. Council letter PERF Report Final
b. Final Report AAR- Cambridge
6. CMA 2024 #33 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Central Square Lots Study Report.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. C2 Lots Study Final Report Memo 2-28-24
b. 20240228_Central Square City Lots Final Report - Pages compressed
7. CMA 2024 #34 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item Number 24-4, regarding recommendations and legal opinions for adjusting transportation related fees and other considered changes based on the conversations in committee on December 6, 2023.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. Opinion - Awaiting Report No. 24-004 - Transportation Related Fees
8. CMA 2024 #35 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a communication regarding the American Rescue Plan Act’s (“ARPA”) definition of "Obligation."
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. ARPA Opinion Ltr. 3.4.24 final
9. CMA 2024 #36 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item Number 24-7, regarding a review of the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee.
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. AR 24-7 - Review of Charter Review Committee Final Report (002)
II. Calendar
Unfinished Business
1. ORDD-2023-2 : An Ordinance 2023 #8B has been received from City Clerk, relative to Amend Chapter 14.04 – Fair Housing. PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2, 2023. FURTHER AMENDED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023. THIS ITEM WILL REMAIN ON UNFINISHED BUSINESS UNTIL THE STATE LEGISLATURE APPROVES THE SPECIAL ACT THAT IS NEEDED BEFORE THIS CAN BE ORDAINED
b. Fair Housing Ordinance lanugage passed to a second reading on October 2 2023 and further amended on November 6 2023 8B
III. Applications and Petitions
1. APP 2024 #7 : An application was received from Dylan James, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises numbered 10 Hazel Street, Cambridge, MA; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. Response has been received from the neighborhood association.
Application and Petitions Printout

b. RE_ Curb Cut 10 Hazel Street

VI. Policy Order and Resolution List
1. POR 2024 #26 : That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to consider a request for a dedication in a suitable location in honor of Paul Ryder.
Policy Order Printout
2. POR 2024 #27 : That the City Manager is requested to dispatch the appropriate City personnel to assess the sidewalks in and around Carl Barron Plaza, paying particular attention to those areas that may be hazardous for seniors and those with mobility impediments.
Policy Order Printout

VII. Committee Reports
1. Minutes of Feb 15, 2024 12:00 PM
VIII. Communications and Reports from Other City Officers
1. COF 2024 #22 : A communication was received from Diane LeBlanc, City Clerk, transmitting an update regarding legislative activity.
Communication and Report from Other City Officers Printout
a. Updated Hearing Schedule 2.28.2024
b. PENDING HOME RULE PETITIONS MARCH 4, 2024
c. 2024-2025 Committee Referral List
d. Pending Zoning Petitions and Municipal Ordinances Chart
Appended Information
Awaiting Report Status Update
2. ARS-24-4 : Awaiting Report Status Update 3/4/2024
a. Awaiting Report Status Update 3.4.2024
Awaiting Report List
3. AR-24-3 : Report back after conferring with relevant City departments on potential public renewable energy projects that could receive funding through the IRA Direct Pay provision.
4. AR-24-4 : Report on recommendations and legal opinions for adjusting transportation related fees and other considered changes based on the conversations in committee on December 6, 2023.
5. AR-24-6 : Report on the research of rules and regulations governing the use of Electric Micromobility Devices and what, if any, authority Cambridge has to introduce its own regulations of these Devices including speed and location of use, and report back to the City Council in a timely manner.
6. AR-24-7 : A report on a review of the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee and its proposals and provide written feedback on the legality, and practicality of the proposals in advance of future discussion.
7. AR-24-8 : Report on the recommendations for the refinement and improvement of the housing permitting process to the City Council, with a focus on reducing delays, minimizing costs, and enhancing clarity and accessibility for all stakeholders.
8. AR-24-9 : Report on the conference with the City Manager’s Housing Liaison, Community Development Department, and the Cambridge Housing Authority on the feasibility of municipally-funded housing vouchers.
9. AR-24-10 : Report to the City Council with the data analysis included in the Economic Feasibility Analysis provided to EOHLC as part of Cambridge’s MBTA Communities final compliance submission.
Adjournment
